title: Mordekaiser is nothing with the passive.
body:
Mordekaiser is only strong because is passive is strong. Notice how I said strong and not broken, because it just deals max hp damage and gives some movement speed, that’s it. But because it is hard to proc the passive that’s the problem.

His Q deals pretty much 0 damage in the late game with a ridiculously long CD at all stages of the game.

His W is fair enough. Shielding + heal similar to Tahm Kench.

His E is like a shit version of Darius E. Darius E will pull targets hit. Morde’s E does whatever is feels like.

His R can just be countered by a QSS costing 1300g and since he is a magic damage dealer, QSS is even better against Morde.

If Morde didn’t have his passive, this champion would be a laughing joke.

replies.body:
Mordekaiser's passive is hard to proc? You have to hit the enemy 3 times with _anything_. Q, E, autos, they all count. That's actually not really hard to proc at all.

> His Q [...] with a ridiculously long CD at all stages of the game.

The CD when maxed is 4 seconds.... that's ridiculously long for you? With CDR, you can bring this even down to 2.4 seconds. Ridiculously long... really?
What CDR items? Rylais, Liandrys, Morrelos no CDR. What do you expect to me to build?
At absolute most I'd want to buy only one of those.  Grabbing all of them makes you too soft to consistently stay alive unless you are leaps ahead of everyone in the game.

CDR items which Mordekaiser tends to buy:

Hail of Blades alone let's me pop it constantly.
